atom.epistula package#

Submodules#

atom.epistula.epistula module#

class atom.epistula.epistula.Epistula(allowed_delta_ms=None)[source]#

Bases: object

Manages the generation and verification of cryptographic signatures for messages. Handles both header generation and signature verification in a unified interface.

static create_message_body(data)[source]#

Utility method to create message body from dictionary data

Return type:

bytes

generate_header(hotkey, body, signed_for=None)[source]#

Generate headers containing signatures and metadata for a message.

Parameters:

  • hotkey (Keypair) – The keypair used for signing

  • body (bytes) – The message body in bytes

  • signed_for (Optional[str]) – Receiver’s address (optional)

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary containing all necessary headers

verify_signature(signature, body, timestamp, uuid, signed_by, signed_for=None, now=None)[source]#

Verify the signature of a message.

Parameters:

  • signature (str) – The signature to verify

  • body (bytes) – Message body in bytes

  • timestamp (str) – Message timestamp

  • uuid (str) – Message UUID

  • signed_by (str) – Sender’s address

  • signed_for (Optional[str]) – Receiver’s address (optional)

  • now (Optional[int]) – Current timestamp (defaults to current time if not provided) in seconds

Return type:

Optional[str]

Returns:

None if verification succeeds, error message string if it fails

class atom.epistula.epistula.VerifySignatureRequest(**data)[source]#

Bases: BaseModel

Pydantic model for the verify_signature input parameters.

body: bytes#
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}#

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

now: Optional[int]#
signature: Annotated[str]#
signed_by: str#
signed_for: Optional[str]#
timestamp: int#
uuid: Annotated[str]#
